subject: p13762730
Findings: There are parenchymal opacities in the right middle lobe. There are also -opacities in the region of the lingula. Dual-chamber pacer in the left upper chest terminates in the right atrium and ventricle, stable. Mild cardiomegaly and tortuous aorta is unchanged. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Hyperexpansion and flattened hemidiphragms suggest COPD.
Impression: Right middle lobe and lingular pneumonia.
